instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2916: What is 820-2916? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2916</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b - asd
threads.message:
Guys,

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B

I just tested with ASD (picture attached) in EFI and passed, however if I try test with OS, I dont get nothing, just gray screen. This happen if I try boot with external and internal hard drive as well.

Did you guys have any idea what could be in this case?

thank you

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2916</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b - asd
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2916</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> is not a motherboard number, I guess you mean <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> in such case take it to Apple for a free repair..... There is still time.....

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2916</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b - asd
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2916</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b - asd
threads.message: Wrong board number and how can you not know about the GPU recall? *bites lip*
